instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed. boot but black screen but stay illuminated after apple logo
threads.message:
Board initially have fan spin for 1 second and stop, there is flux around the GPU so it has been worked on, removed <RESISTOR>R8911</RESISTOR> and flashed bios with "<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Ok no GPU clean ME.rar" and now it chimes and boot up.

But fan stuck at high speed, as soon as it finished with the Apple boot logo and the loading bar, it switched to a black screen (screen still illuminated but just black). If I press the power button, i can turn off the screen. Press the power button again I sometime see the login screen for less than a second and then it go black(still illuminated).

If i press option key while booting, as soon as something is shown on the screen, it turn black too(illuminated).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed. boot but black screen but stay illuminated after apple logo
threads.message:
Upload your backup BIOS and we try to disable GPU on it.
I hope you didn't do PRAM reset after flashing BIOS.
Put always EFI password to protect against accidental reset.
Flashing GMUX is faster (no need to remove board from shell) and resists to PRAM reset.
Tiresias GPUkiller is the better way, as it also adjust backlight.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed. boot but black screen but stay illuminated after apple logo
threads.message:
I actually just tried to rewrite the original bios AND did a nvram reset. 

With <RESISTOR>R8911</RESISTOR> removed, I should have a complete black screen but I DID NOT. I see the exact same thing as I mentioned above. white screen-> apple logo->black screen but illuminated.

I also saw <TRANSISTOR>Q9707</TRANSISTOR> area has flux and soldering sign..

Possible messed up gmux?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed. boot but black screen but stay illuminated after apple logo
threads.message:
Board boots with Intel Graphics and screen goes black when switch to GPU.
You should try disabling GPU in original BIOS...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed. boot but black screen but stay illuminated after apple logo
threads.message: Ok I disabled GPU in the original bios and now I believe the problem is corrupted LVDS data line.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed. boot but black screen but stay illuminated after apple logo
threads.message:
I tried to add this nvram var into the original BIOS with value 01. Still the same. White screen power on, if I press Option button during bootup, as soon as something begin to show the screen will go black. 

However, I tried to boot up a text mode linux and SOMETIMES i can see some output on the screen but it will STILL intermittently go black , then after a while I keep on pressing enter and then something will be shown on the screen.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed. boot but black screen but stay illuminated after apple logo
threads.message:
Located <RESISTOR>R9235</RESISTOR> touching the <RESISTOR>R9237</RESISTOR>. Corrected it and now system boot up fine.

I also saw missing <TRANSISTOR>Q5502</TRANSISTOR>, I took one from donor board and replaced it.

However, I still have high fan spin... where should I look now?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed. boot but black screen but stay illuminated after apple logo
threads.message:
Run corresponding ASD EFI and see errors reported.
At least run HWMonitor, it can helps too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed. boot but black screen but stay illuminated after apple logo
threads.message:
ah.. I just found out that the gmux is probably flashed.. as I did nvram reset and STILL only seeing iGPU. 

That shouldnt have anything to do with this high fan spin right? 

Let me try HWMonitor first.. dont have the ASD EFI..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed. boot but black screen but stay illuminated after apple logo
threads.message:
HWMonitor said:

Airport Proximity 129 C
Mainboard Proximity 128 C
Heatpipe Outgoing Air 128 C

[ATTACH type="full"]59446[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed. boot but black screen but stay illuminated after apple logo
threads.message: Check if something change disconnecting webcam.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed. boot but black screen but stay illuminated after apple logo
threads.message:
disconnecting webcam didnt change anything.

But I measured the <TRANSISTOR>Q5502</TRANSISTOR> again and it seems bad. Removed it and HWMonitor still show the same reading.  I have replaced it again and the high spin fan is gone!
